snippet: Four Democrats were on hand at a ceremony to name a section of Broadway after a Dominican man thought to have been New York’s first non-Indian settler.
abstract: New York City mayoral candidates Bill de Blasio, Christine C Quinn, William C Thompson and Adolfo Carrion Jr, in latest effort to appeal to Hispanic voters, attend ceremony in Washington Heights to name section of Broadway after Dominican man believe to be first non-Indian New Yorker; Juan Rodriguez is believe to have arrived in what is now New York City in 1613, 12 years before the Dutch founded New Amsterdam.
lead_paragraph: Four Democrats were on hand at a ceremony to name a section of Broadway after a Dominican man thought to have been New York’s first non-Indian settler.

headline.seo: In Washington Heights, 4 Mayoral Candidates Woo Hispanics
headline.main: Street-Naming Event Gives Mayoral Hopefuls a Chance to Woo Hispanics
headline.print_headline: Street-Naming Event Gives Mayoral Hopefuls a Chance to Woo Hispanics
